title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<Slashman> has quit

10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> good morning Enygma`  
10:12 <vmassol> let's hope we can release today!  
10:12 <vmassol> I saw a lot of failures on wysiwyg yesterday  
10:12 <Enygma`> `morning  
10:12 <vmassol> but I couldn't figure out the issue  
10:13 <Enygma`> you were looking at the quality build, right?  
10:13 <vmassol> yes  
10:13 <Enygma`> since the regular builds seem fine  
10:13 <vmassol> indeed, I don't get that  
10:49 <vmassol> FYI we now have a script on ci.xwiki.org to set the jdk to use for all the jobs on a branch: http://ci.xwiki.org/scriptler/editScript?id=set-jdk-name.groovy  
10:50 <vmassol> actually the correct url is http://ci.xwiki.org/scriptler/runScript?id=set-jdk-name.groovy  
11:09 <acotiuga> Hello! I have an issue on XE 7.4.1 with PDF/HTML Export related to the getRenderedContent() call. It looks like the content of the <renderedContent> element from the document's xml is not completely rendered. I pasted on https://up1.xwikisas.com/#DQ9SRirYS9eNINWbYMP4Kg a nice formatted version of the <renderedContent> element. I can see that the content is displayed only for the first 36 lines (at Meeting.MeetingClass\_0\_place ), just b  
11:15 <vmassol> hi acotiuga  
11:15 <woshilapin> has quit  
11:16 <vmassol> missing the end of your question  
11:18 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <vmassol> Enygma`: see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13126?focusedCommentId=90101&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-90101  
11:28 <amack2> Hi, I've created a pull request on Saturday and I was wondering if I could get some feedback for it. It's the latest with the sourcemaps for LESS/CSS. Thanks.  
11:41 <vmassol> amack2: yep seen it, thanks. Was waiting for gdelhumeau to provide some feedback when he has some time  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> amack2: Thanks!  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> amack2: I'm looking  
11:47 <amack2> let me add the config change too  
11:53 <amack2> gdelhumeau: ok, fixed it  
11:54 <amack2> gdelhumeau: now for the qualilty build  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> note that my comments are about making things even better, but your original work was very good :)  
12:07 <amack2> gdelhumeau: I understand. My "work" was basically only a few lines of code really.  
12:17 <amack2> gdelhumeau: I got [WARNING] Rule violated for bundle XWiki Platform - LESS CSS - Default: instructions covered ratio is 0.85, but expected minimum is 0.86  
12:17 <vmassol> unlucky! ;)  
12:17 <amack2> gdelhumeau: I do have the tests :( Is there somewhere the result of the coverage, like highlighted source code?  
12:18 <vmassol> amack2: you can get this in your IDE  
12:18 <vmassol> or on sonar.xwiki.org  
12:18 <vmassol> (you sonar.xwiki.org will only report committed stuff)  
12:18 <vmassol> or you can generate a report  
12:18 <vmassol> using this:  
12:18 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HTestCoverage  
12:19 <vmassol> note that for 0.01% we also allow decreasing the coverage ;)  
12:19 <vmassol> (in case you don't find any easy way to test your code lore)  
12:19 <vmassol> \*more  
12:22 <amack2> vmassol: thanks. Using intellij idea, but I can't find the results  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> maybe because isGenerateInlineSourceMaps() is not tested  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> which is not critical IMO  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> with IDEA, you need the ultimate version  
12:24 <amack2> gdelhumeau:  isGenerateInlineSourceMaps() is used in CachedLESSCompiler  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> yes and you have mocked it  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> not tested the configuration component  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> adding a line in the configuration component is adding a non tested line :)  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> which make the coverage decreases  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> but as would do as Vincent suggest, only change the expected minimum  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> in pom.xml  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> -as+I  
12:25 <vmassol> amack2: with intellij it's really simple  
12:25 <vmassol> you just run the test with coverage  
12:26 <vmassol> and then you have the result when you browser the java class in the gutter  
12:26 <vmassol> s/browser/browse  
12:26 <amack2> I got the ultimate, but running maven in it, not the tests directly  
12:27 <amack2> there seems to be no test for LESSConfiguration  
12:35 <acotiuga> has quit  
12:36 <gdelhumeau> on intellij, click right on the module "run tests with converage"  
12:36 <gdelhumeau> and yes, there is no test for LESSConfiguration  
12:36 <gdelhumeau> I have not created it  
12:37 <amack2> I will do it  
12:40 <gene\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:41 <gene> has quit  
12:41 <gene\_> is now known as <gene>  
13:09 <vmassol> has quit  
13:16 <Enygma`> [ANN] Starting the 8.0M2 build on master...  
13:24 <amack2> gdelhumeau: can I add LESSConfiguration to components.txt ?  
13:25 <amack2> hmm it is already there, but I get org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.context.Execution] hint = [default]]  
13:28 <gdelhumeau> you need to do mocker.getInstance(ConfigurationSource.class) in a setUp() method  
13:28 <gdelhumeau> in your test class  
13:28 <gdelhumeau> hmm  
13:29 <gdelhumeau> you have this prblem in xwiki or while executing test?  
13:29 <amack2> I just cargo-culted LESSContextTest ;)  
13:29 <amack2> while doing the test  
13:32 <amack2> can't import ConfigurationSource, it seems to be protected  
13:38 <amack2> ok, found it in another class  
13:40 \* gdelhumeau is discovering https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cargo\_cult :)  
13:42 <cjd> oh yeah, cargo cult programming is when you follow design patterns because other people use them and they're believed to make your code better but you don't understand the mechanism by which they improve quality  
13:45 <cjd> usually cargo cult programming leads to unmaintainable but "clean looking" code because people use programming techniques in places where they don't bring any benefit and the real risks to maintainability of their software are not "on their radar" so they don't use the techniques where they are needed  
13:46 <amack2> cjd: yes, but I'm very new to mockito :)  
13:46 <cjd> oh heh I didn't notice you mentioning that... but then if you say you made that type of error it's reasonable to think that you didn't, because otherwise you wouldn't know it  
13:46 <cjd> :)  
13:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <amack2> gdelhumeau: can you look at http://pastebin.com/QYa12uag ? Any hints?  
14:06 <amack2> it bombs at line 31  
14:07 <amack2> org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.configuration.ConfigurationSource] hint = [xwikiproperties]]  
14:11 <vmassol> evalica: Hi. When you have some time I'd love your input on https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13124. We may even have already discussed it on the list and some link in the issue would be great if we have. If not, maybe this is a topic you could own and make it progress, WDYT?  
14:13 <evalica> vmassol: k - I'll respond to the issue - ty  
14:14 <vmassol> @tmortagn: I'm doing the groovy upgrade!  
14:18 <vmassol> (tmortagne)  
14:20 <vmassol> Enygma`: can I commit on xwiki-commons master?  
14:21 <vmassol> (the groovy upgrade to 2.4.6)  
14:21 <tmortagne> vmassol: after the release no ?  
14:21 <vmassol> (don't know where you are with the release)  
14:21 <tmortagne> Edy started the release  
14:21 <vmassol> is commons done?  
14:21 <tmortagne> Enygma`I mean  
14:22 <vmassol> answer is probably not  
14:22 <vmassol> don't recall seing a github commit mail  
14:22 <vmassol> \*git  
14:22 <vmassol> (actually github ;))  
14:22 <Enygma`> just started it again now  
14:22 <Enygma`> this time it should work...  
14:23 <vmassol> k  
14:23 <vmassol> preparing RN for 8.0RC1 then  
14:29 <vmassol> creating 8.1 versions in jira….  
14:31 <vmassol> done  
14:31 <gdelhumeau> amack2: you don't need to specify "xwikiproperties"  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> otherwise it looks right  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> except that I should rather use .thenReturn(true) instead of false  
14:32 <gdelhumeau> because false is returned by default by the mocker  
14:33 <gdelhumeau> so you don't really test anything here  
14:33 <gdelhumeau> hmm  
14:33 <gdelhumeau> mayeb it returns null by default actually  
14:38 <amack2> gdelhumeau: thanks. Works for getMaximumSimultaneousCompilations. isGenerateInlineSourceMaps gets a NullPointerException  
14:40 <amack2> gdelhumeau: it works now.  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> :)  
14:40 <amack2> let me build with quality and then I'll push  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> hope it will fix your converage issue  
14:44 <amack2> LESSConfiguration has now 100% as opposed to 0% before ;)  
14:46 <D-Spair> has quit  
14:48 <vmassol> Enygma`: please let me know when I can commit on comomns  
14:49 <Enygma`> vmassol: yep, as soon as the release finishes building I`ll let you know.  
14:56 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you check if this last change is correct?  
15:01 <tmortagne> it is  
15:01 <vmassol> ok I've updated http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+my+Extension+know+if+XWiki+supports+Nested+Spaces too  
15:05 <msmeria> has quit  
15:14 <xwiki\_finstern> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <xwiki\_finstern> hello  
15:27 <amack2> gdelhumeau: Updated the pull request.  
15:27 <gdelhumeau> good  
15:27 <gdelhumeau> nice commit messages :)  
15:28 <amack2> well you never can be too exact ;)  
15:28 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <gdelhumeau> amack2: I will merge it when Enygma` has finished the release of XWiki 8.0 milestone 2  
15:36 <amack2> gdelhumeau: give me a few more mins to incorp your comments. Should I leave the commit messages like this or was it supposed to be that the first line containts the description?  
15:38 <gdelhumeau> I don't think I've understood your question, but a commit message like https://github.com/andrm/xwiki-platform/commit/7c3af207cab07be19e9c8ad87072a547b7a05088 is good  
15:47 <amack2> gdelhumeau: all up  
15:47 <Enygma`> vmassol: release build done  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> thanks amack2  
16:00 <xwiki\_finstern> gdelhumeau I wanted to thank you for your suggestions of solution you offered me last week  
16:00 <xwiki\_finstern> it worked perfectly  
16:00 <xwiki\_finstern> thank you  
16:01 <xwiki\_finstern> (about the colortheme option for user profile)  
16:04 <xwiki\_finstern> (struggled a bit to use a static list, until I understood that we could change "value1" )  
16:05 <amack2> gdelhumeau: thank you too  
16:06 <gdelhumeau> Nice xwiki\_finstern :)  
16:06 <tmortagne> Enygma`: FYI: looks like the parent pom version was not properly updated by the release script  
16:06 <gdelhumeau> Actually I think you can improve it  
16:06 <tmortagne> seen anything in the log about that ?  
16:06 <gdelhumeau> by using the displayer  
16:06 <Slashman> has quit  
16:06 <tmortagne> release script log I mean  
16:07 <xwiki\_finstern> I'm afraid I will be annoying, but I havn't found what file is used to store the top menu options, I have my application in a subwiki and I would like to hide the "Accueil" link that lead to the root wiki for the non admin users, anybody know where I can change that ?  
16:07 <gdelhumeau> xwiki\_finstern: adding "{{include reference="XWiki.ColorThemePropertyDisplayer" /}}" in the option "custom displayer" of your "colorTheme" property in your XWiki.XWikiUsers class  
16:08 <gdelhumeau> which version xwiki\_finstern ?  
16:08 <xwiki\_finstern> I think it's 7.1 or 7.2, let me check a sec please  
16:08 <gdelhumeau> it must be in menusview.vm, or in menus\_home.vm  
16:08 <Enygma`> tmortagne: I had a failed git push on platform master due to your commit, but I`ve pushed separately from the release script (which went on to enterprise) and it should be fine  
16:08 <xwiki\_finstern> 7.1.1  
16:08 <gdelhumeau> xwiki\_finstern: it's a file on the filesystem  
16:08 <Enygma`> need to look at the parents  
16:08 <xwiki\_finstern> this is my version  
16:09 <tmortagne> hmm the script should to a pull before the push then to be safer  
16:09 <tmortagne> just before the push I mean  
16:09 <xwiki\_finstern> looking into this, thank you  
16:10 <gdelhumeau> damn, http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Nested+Pages+Migrator+Application/plan.png is not updated  
16:11 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yes, probably  
16:11 <Enygma`> looking at the parent update commits and they seem weird indeed  
16:11 <gdelhumeau> we have an issue,  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewattachrev/Extension/Nested+Pages+Migrator+Application/plan.png  shows 3 versions and http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Nested+Pages+Migrator+Application/plan.png is not the last one  
16:12 <Enygma`> tmortagne:  think I need to run the parent updating command we used to do in the past  
16:13 <tmortagne> it's not weird it's a XSLT transformation but for some reason it did not catched the version  
16:14 <tmortagne> and XSLT rewrite the XML and sometime "optimize" it  
16:15 <tmortagne> no idea how to make it keep empty lines  
16:15 <tmortagne> but anyway this is not an issue  
16:15 <tmortagne> I don't know why it did not catched the version, will try to debug  
16:16 <tmortagne> hmm https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/4a9025c9e878cdc542a21bf7536292246f726ef0#diff-600376dffeb79835ede4a0b285078036L259 is not very nice  
16:17 <tmortagne> a pity Maven version plugin is so unusable for something as simple as setting a parent version  
16:17 <tmortagne> it only accept to set something that exist which is not the case for stable releases  
16:19 <Enygma`> so the way I see it, the parent was not updated for top level projects only  
16:21 <tmortagne> I just executed the xsltproc locally and the version is properly changed  
16:21 <tmortagne> a copy paste of the command from the script  
16:22 <tmortagne> Enygma`: yes I'm talking about repository parent  
16:22 <tmortagne> release plugin is taking care of the other parents  
16:22 <tmortagne> do you still have the release log available ?  
16:22 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:23 <tmortagne> see if there is a warning or something related to xsltproc  
16:23 <tmortagne> because I really have no idea why it's not working on a1-1 and it's working well on my side  
16:23 <tmortagne> it's like $NEXT\_SNAPSHOT\_VERSION was wrong  
16:24 <tmortagne> but that's what is used for everything  
16:24 <Enygma`> after the building was done  
16:24 <tmortagne> so nothing in the log  
16:25 <gdelhumeau> amack2: added documentation there: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/LESS+Module#HDebuggingLESSfileswithCSSSourceMaps  
16:25 <amack2> gdelhumeau: great!  
16:26 <tmortagne> Enygma`: the command works well on a1-1 so the only thing that can bee wrong is $NEXT\_SNAPSHOT\_VERSION, I don't understand  
16:27 <Enygma`> if that was wrong, would the child artifact versions still be set ok by the release plugin?  
16:27 <tmortagne> this variable contain the answer to "What is the next SNAPSHOT version?"  
16:28 <tmortagne> Enygma`: (04:24:25 PM) tmortagne: but that's what is used for everything  
16:28 <tmortagne> so yes everything should be wrong  
16:28 <Slashman> has quit  
16:28 <tmortagne> it's also the variable that was used before XSLT based move  
16:28 <tmortagne> so I have no idea what happen  
16:29 <Enygma`> What is the next SNAPSHOT version?  
16:30 <tmortagne> actually I'm sure the variable is correct since that's what is used one line before to update commons.version and this one is right  
16:31 <tmortagne> so it's something wrong somewhere in "xsltproc -o pom.xml --stringparam parentversion "$NEXT\_SNAPSHOT\_VERSION" $PRGDIR/clirr-excludes.xslt pom.xml"  
16:31 <tmortagne> ${NEXT\_SNAPSHOT\_VERSION} is right in the following command so I guess it's not it  
16:32 <tmortagne> the right xslt is executed as otherwise we would not have the "cleanup"  
16:33 <tmortagne> so it does not make any sense to me right now...  
16:38 <tmortagne> Enygma`: I found what is the issue...  
16:38 <Enygma`> tmortagne: what was it?  
16:39 <tmortagne> copy/paste, look at the name of the xslt file in the command I pasted  
16:39 <tmortagne> of course in when I tested I tested with the right one since it was a different path  
16:41 <tmortagne> no wonder why https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/4a9025c9e878cdc542a21bf7536292246f726ef0#diff-600376dffeb79835ede4a0b285078036L259 looked so weird  
16:48 <Enygma`> tmortagne: it was the xslt for clirr excludes :)  
16:49 <tmortagne> yep  
16:49 <tmortagne> programmer bug  
16:59 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:59 <Slashman> has quit  
17:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
17:23 <xwiki\_finstern> hmmmh  
17:23 <xwiki\_finstern> when you define a class sheet  
17:23 <xwiki\_finstern> For the Static list type, is there a way to edit the text displayed ?  
17:23 <xwiki\_finstern> like if you want to make it show in heavy or italic ?  
17:24 <sorinello> has quit  
17:24 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
17:24 <vmassol> has quit  
17:24 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <xwiki\_finstern> wah, my question did that ? :D  
17:25 <vmassol> :)  
17:25 <xwiki\_finstern> that mean I should not ask too much questions :)  
17:26 <vmassol> you can get the value of a static list  
17:26 <vmassol> and then you display it the way you want  
17:27 <vmassol> $document.getValue("…")  
17:27 <vmassol> (for example)  
17:27 <xwiki\_finstern> that would be awesome, you define it in the custom display area ?  
17:27 <vmassol> \*\*$value\*\*  
17:28 <vmassol> ah you can also do that in the custom display  
17:28 <vmassol> I was talkig about the sheet  
17:28 <vmassol> \*talking  
17:28 <xwiki\_finstern> ah right, ok  
17:28 <vmassol> here's an example of a custom display if that's what you want:  
17:28 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User+Property+Custom+Display  
17:29 <vmassol> as you can see $value is bound to the value  
17:29 <vmassol> trying to find ref doc for custom display but can't find it, I wonder if we have such a doc ;)  
17:30 <xwiki\_finstern> that's an intersting document I hadn't found, thank you Vincent I will look at this data  
17:30 <vmassol> this thread gives you the bindings that exist  
17:30 <vmassol> http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/Help-with-custom-display-td508630.html  
17:30 <vmassol> - $name = the name of the displayed field  
17:30 <vmassol> - $prefix = a prefix for the form field  
17:30 <vmassol> - $value = the property value  
17:30 <vmassol> but we need to document this properly...  
17:30 <xwiki\_finstern> I have looked for such information for a long time, thank you very much  
17:31 <vmassol> found it  
17:31 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Which+variables+I+can+use+in+%22Custom+Display%22+field  
17:31 <xwiki\_finstern> when you have documented it, maybe add a link to the class documentation, it would be usefull  
17:31 <vmassol> we're still missing a doc proper for custom display  
17:31 <vmassol> you mean from http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/DataModel ?  
17:32 <xwiki\_finstern> there are a lot of documents avaiable, but sometime difficult to find what you look for, especially when you don't know the right word for your search  
17:32 <xwiki\_finstern> yes  
17:32 <vmassol> yes, we'd love to improve this… we need some help :)  
17:33 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XINFRA-89  
17:33 <xwiki\_finstern> the datamodel document should have a link to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Which+variables+I+can+use+in+%22Custom+Display%22+field  
17:33 <xwiki\_finstern> I think it would be really usefull  
17:33 <xwiki\_finstern> how many of you are working on xwiki project currently ?  
17:34 <vmassol> xwiki\_finstern: feel free to add such a link  
17:34 <vmassol> (it's a wiki! :))  
17:34 <xwiki\_finstern> I alway see the 5/6 same people working on it  
17:34 <vmassol> yes there are about 5-6 persons working daily on xwiki  
17:34 <vmassol> then about 10-15 working actively on it  
17:35 <vmassol> and then about 50 or so contributing in total  
17:35 <xwiki\_finstern> ok  
17:35 <vmassol> but 80% or more is done by those 5-6 working daily on it  
17:35 <vmassol> we'd love to get more contributions though :)  
17:35 <xwiki\_finstern> the most knowledgeable ones I assume ^^
